resources.string: The University of Texas at Austin EWH Audiometry Test
What would you like to do?

Before the audiometry test is performed, the headphones must be calibrated. Ensure that the headphones being used are firmly plugged into the headphone jack and that they do NOT have a microphone on them. Press the button below when you\'re ready to see calibration instructions. Once the headphones are calibrated, you can begin the audiometry test.
Tap When You Hear A Beep

This audiometry test is a simple procedure designed to evaluate your hearing capabilities. Once the test begins, you will hear beeps of various pitches and volumes. Every time you hear a beep, simply tap the screen. That\'s it! Tap the button below when you\'re ready to begin.

In order to get accurate readings from the audiometer, your headphones must be calibrated. Please plug in your headphones into the headphone jack on your device. Place your headphone speaker as close as possible to your device microphone without touching it. For best results, perform this calibration in a quiet room. Tap the button below when you\'re ready to begin calibration.
Do you want to keep your results?
Please enter the email address you would like to send the most recently saved test results to.

Now that calibration is complete, you can take the audiometry test. This audiometry test is a simple procedure designed to evaluate your hearing capabilities. Once the test begins, you will hear beeps of various pitches and volumes. Every time you hear a beep, simply tap the screen. That\'s it! Tap the button below when you\'re ready to begin.
If you can\'t find the test results in your inbox, be sure to check your junk or spam folder.
Special thanks to: Pato Lankenau, Davin Siu, and James Yao
Developed for Texas Engineering World Health as a submission for the 2014 EWH Design Competition.
Questions or concerns about the app? Email reecestevens@utexas.edu.
Export seems to have run into a problem. Please check your internet connection and try again. You can export your test results at any time using the export button on the main page of the app!
